column4: hello, a freind of mine screwed (like really messed up) his permissions.  according to ls -al, /home/him/.gnome2/ has full rwx permissions, but whenever he tries to boot gnome, he gets an error saying that something needs to edit .gnome2 and cannot get permissions.
hello, I'm trying to play a media file with strange, ultra new windows codecs called h264... how do I install them?
works in any of the media players
you'll be prompted to install codecs
what player? mplayer works? totem (gstreamer) needs plugins downloaded though
if you've got mplayer from apt, it'll have support
whats a new version? version of the codec? mplayer isnt at 2.X....
play it from terminal with mplayer, see what it says, /msg me
you need win32codecs for mplayer or the bad-plugins for gstreamer
you still there?  I installed something called avifile-win32-plugin from the repos, that didn't work
